item.title: The Gambler’s Ruin: A Simple Explanation and Derivation
item.description: I’ve recently had the itch to break out some textbooks and do a little math. Don’t ask me where that desire comes from, but I find working on math problems fun. A few years ago I bought a probability textbook, which I learned about through an Amazon review by my intellectual hero, Nassim Taleb (here’s the review). Since then it has mainly been sitting on my book shelf, but occasionally I leaf through it and try to refresh my memory on some concept or learn a new one.
